attributes.action: Implement what has been petitioned for through the No. 10 website petitions where more than 40,000 signatures (Gurkha test of public opinion) are achieved.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Where more than 40,000 signatures to petitions on this site are achieved, the simple non committal written responses are not adequate and Government should better recognise the strength of feeling on an issue, as evidenced by the Gurkha petition that achieved 40,351 signatures and consequent public furore.

The Prime Minister should agree to set up cross party committees to study each plus 40,000 petitions proposals in detail, and make recommendations for implementation with a bill, if necessary, to be put before Parliament. Those that have signed up to the petition should be invited to make written submissions to be put in the public domain, and then invite a cross section of those making a submission to give evidence in person.

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
